item.description:
Date: Oct. 21 & 22, 2009
Time: 9 a.m.
Location: LOB, Rm. 202-204
Committee: Ways and Means
Subject: State revenue information session

http://www.gencourt.s....

Keep Oct. 21 & 22 open. Rep. Susan Almy is holding a summit to consider changes to NH’s tax laws. Almy is one of the most vocal income tax supporters in Concord. Please read the Union Leader article at:

http://www.unionleade....

There were a lot of comments made and Almy responded with:

“Grow up. This is not secret, every member of my committee has been consulted, of both parties. It is not a summit, it is an informational session in which we are going to try to get business input on our current tax structure. And I am not going to name people we haven't invited yet! If they choose not to participate that's their affair. I would thank the Union Leader to check its facts before it trumpets its accusations. You are supposed to be a newspaper.
- Susan Almy, Lebanon”

Let’s not lose the NH advantage. Get your signs ready. No income or sales tax.
item.name: Income Tax Protest
